page.title: 15A WASTE DISPOSAL TIP
page.content: Furfield Landfill used to be called Furfield Quarry. The quarrying of ragstone here started in the early 1950's and finished in 1964. Now it is a waste disposal tip taking 90% commercial rubbish, such as builder's rubble, and 10% household rubbish. It has been in operation for about 5 years, but there was, and still is, considerable local opposition to its existence, since its south side is bordered by the Loose Stream. The operators say that the tip takes no toxic substances and there is no pollution of the stream from the tip's 5250000 sq.ft. A Monitoring Committee, which includes representatives from the operators, the KCC, the Water Authority and local organizations and rsidents, meets regularly. Some people still fear for the future of the stream.
